intro: Garcinia terpnophylla var. terpnophylla, commonly known as the Philippine yellow mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Clusiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits with a thick, waxy rind and a sweet, aromatic pulp. Its botanical features make it distinct in its native habitat, though it is not widely cultivated beyond local regions.
